articles.title: Local Computer Boots Up Slightly Faster Than Yesterday
articles.body: Experts are unsure why the system started in 14.2 seconds instead of 14.3. The computer declined to comment, but did make a strange clicking noise.

articles.title: New Operating System Update Adds Button That Does Nothing
articles.body: Users report the button looks important but has no visible effect. Pressing it repeatedly provides emotional comfort.

articles.title: Researchers Discover Folder That No One Remembers Creating
articles.body: The folder, named 'new_final_v3_REAL', contains nothing but older folders with the same name.

articles.title: Internet Slows Down After 9PM For Unknown Reasons
articles.body: Network engineers insist nothing changes at night. Users disagree, stating the internet becomes 'tired'.

articles.title: User Accidentally Fixes Bug By Staring At Code Long Enough
articles.body: The issue resolved itself shortly after the user whispered 'please' to the monitor.

articles.title: System Clock Gains One Second, Refuses To Give It Back
articles.body: Time synchronization services are investigating. The clock insists the second was 'earned'.
